intro: Ixiolaena websteri, commonly known as the dwarf papyrus, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its compact, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense clusters, typical of the sedge family. Ixiolaena websteri is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and ease of care.
